intro: Dodonaea filifolia, commonly known as the silky oaks, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its compound leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, which bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to a variety of soil types. Dodonaea filifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal and semi-arid environments.
